data: Refer to Hypoxic-Ischemic Encephalopathy Neurological Stabilization Guideline
If requiring neurovital assessments, select NICU Neurological Assessment (Neurovital Signs) (Module)
Encephalopathy score to be completed on admission, then at 4 hours, then daily
Continuous temperature via rectal probe to meet goal temperature
If urine output exceeds 4 mL/kg/h over 12 hours or if urine output is less than 1 mL/kg/h over 12 hours
Refer to Neurological: Criticool: Operating Procedure
Goal temperature: 33.5 degC, for 72 hour after initiating cooling, use Cooling Mode with Criticool to meet target core temperature for a total of 72 hours
Goal temperature: 36.7 to 37 degC, for 120 hour after initiating cooling, use Cooling Mode with Criticool to meet target core temperature for a total of 120 hours
Goal temperature: 36.5 degC, for 8 hour, use Neonatal Rewarming mode with Criticool after 72 hours of cooling. Increase set point temperature by 0.4 DegC q1h
Ensure Total Fluid Intake has been ordered in the appropriate admission order sets. Recommended Total Fluid Intake is 50 mL/kg/day. Recommended maintenance fluid is dextrose 10% continuous infusion
If seizures, consider NICU Initial Seizure Management (Module)
Suggested morphine continuous infusion rate: 5 mcg/kg/h to 10 mcg/kg/h
morphine NEO continuous infusion (100 mcg/mL) in D5W 25 mL
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once

f patient has an arterial line and requires ionized calcium, select POC Arterial Gas. If patient does not have an arterial line and requires lab collect, select Capillary Blood Gas
q12h interval for 2 doses or times
T+1;N, qdaily for 2 doses or times
q12h interval for 2 doses or times

q12h interval for 2 doses or times
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when arterial and venous blood gas required, then ensure lactate is documented with gas results
If/when abnormal cardiac rhythm noted, then print electrocardiogram tracing
Physician to attach and complete an aEEG reporting checklist for each printed page
Scheduling Priority: Within 24 hours, Reason For Exam: Suspected Hypoxic-Ischemic Encephalopathy, Schedule as: Inpatient, Scheduling Locations: BCH EEG EMG, Portable
MRI Head and Spectroscopy w/o Contrast
Urgent, Special Instructions: To be done when rewarming is completed
If patient is unstable for Day 3 MRI or clinically indicated, consider +10 day follow up MRI
If concern of clinical or sub-clinical seizures, discuss continuous EEG monitoring with Neurology
Consult with Neonatal Neurology or Neurology after-hours.  NICU and Neurology to confirm MRI booking after re-warming is complete
Consider consultation with Cardiology if on inotrope/vasopressor support
